title: SCI Complications — Cardiovascular & Systemic
description: Recognize and respond to AD, OH, DVT/PE, and other complications. Practice crisis simulation and flashcards.

screens.title: Autonomic Dysreflexia (AD)
screens.body: AD is a medical emergency. Symptoms include headache, hypertension, sweating above lesion, and bradycardia.

screens.back: Sudden drop in blood pressure upon standing. Manage with gradual position changes and compression stockings.

screens.question: What is the first step in managing suspected AD?
screens.explanation: Sit the patient upright to lower blood pressure, then check for noxious stimulus.

screens.prompt: Patient with SCI reports pounding headache and high BP after bowel care.

options.result: Unsafe — stop and address AD immediately.

options.text: Sit patient upright and check for triggers
options.result: Correct — this is the first step in AD management.
Pain relief does not address AD.
